benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Add custom fields to account

covered: Valid Payload scenarios covered: TC01–TC05 validate successful creation with required and optional headers across accounts with/without existing custom fields.
Invalid Payload scenarios covered: TC06–TC09 address invalid accountId, missing header, malformed body, and empty body.

Validation and data integrity coverage: TC11 (unsupported fields), TC12 (duplicate field names), TC27 (partial input), TC28 (incorrect data types), TC29 (value bounds), TC30 (null values), TC26 (empty array).
Boundary and size handling covered: TC14 (max payload) and TC15 (payload too large).
Security tests covered: TC18 (SQL injection) and TC19 (XSS).
Authorization and header validation: TC16 (unauthorized/invalid token) and TC07 (missing required header) alongside TC01-created-by scenarios.
Recovery and resilience tests: TC20 (retry after transient failure), TC17 (service unavailable), and TC25 (inconsistent data handling).
Performance tests: TC21 (normal load latency) and TC22 (peak load).
Regression and backward compatibility: TC23 and TC24.
Query parameter handling: TC13 (unexpected query parameter).
Account state scenarios: TC04 (account with no custom fields) and TC05 (account with existing custom fields) and TC10 (non-existent account).
gaps: Rate limiting/throttling scenarios are not covered.
Caching behavior (ETag / Cache-Control) is not tested.
500 Internal Server Error scenarios (e.g., database failure) are not explicitly tested (only 503 in TC17).
Explicit 403 Forbidden handling is not tested (only 401 Unauthorized in TC16).
Explicit idempotency/duplicate-submission handling beyond duplicate field names (TC12) is not covered.
Additional concurrency/race-condition scenarios beyond performance tests are not explicitly covered.
recommendations: Add a test for 403 Forbidden to cover insufficient permissions.
Introduce a 500 Internal Server Error scenario to validate server/database failure handling.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests and caching header validations (ETag, Cache-Control).
Add an explicit idempotency/duplicate-submission test (beyond field-name duplicates).
Enhance concurrency testing with concrete race-condition scenarios and data integrity checks under simultaneous requests.
